title: Man accused of hammer attack on Nancy Pelosi's husband 'named Tom Hanks as target'
description: A man accused of attacking the husband of US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said there was "evil in Washington" and named other targets including actor Tom Hanks, a court has heard.

title: Why the white cliffs of Dover continue to beckon migrants across Channel despite the deadly risk
description: There are two places that can tell you just about everything about why people come from all over the world to northern France, and why they pay thousands of pounds to criminals just to get a place on board a flimsy dinghy.

title: World Cup 2022: Live updates as Morocco takes on France for place in final
US sportswriter Grant Wahl died from aortic aneurysm while covering  World Cup in Qatar, widow says
description: An American sportswriter died from an aortic aneurysm while covering the World Cup in Qatar, his widow has said.

title: Islamic State still a threat and seeking to free 10,000 jailed fighters, experts say
description: While it no longer controls vast swathes of Iraq and Syria, Islamic State remains a threat and will seek to spring 10,000 of its fighters from Syrian prisons in 2023, experts say.

title: Twitter account which tracked Elon Musk's private jet is suspended
description: A Twitter account which tracked Elon Musk's private jet has been suspended.

title: Governor commutes all 17 of Oregon's 'immoral' death sentences
description: Oregon's governor has said she is commuting the sentences of all the state's 17 inmates awaiting execution on death row.

title: No suspects, murder weapon or motive: Mystery of four university students killed in their beds
description: The grey house with the Christmas wreath on the front door and twinkling fairy lights overhanging the back patio could be any other student home in the remote town of Moscow, Idaho.

title: Apple 'set to allow rival app stores on iPhone' to meet EU law
description: Apple is set to allow rival app stores on to the iPhone and iPad in the EU, according to a report.

title: Meta accused of enabling hateful Ethiopia conflict posts in lawsuit
description: Meta has been accused of enabling violent and hateful posts from Ethiopia to flourish on Facebook in a new lawsuit.

title: Would the US really ban one of the world's most popular apps?
description: Democrats and Republicans don't agree on much these days, but have joined forces to unveil bipartisan legislation that would ban TikTok across the US.

title: China's zero-COVID U-turn means rate at which virus is surging will be shrouded in secrecy
description: The fact that China's authorities will no longer report asymptomatic cases sounds technical but it's really significant.

title: UK to train Ukrainian judges to carry out war crimes trials for Russian soldiers
description: A group of 90 Ukrainian judges will undergo training, provided by the UK, to carry out war crimes trials for Russian soldiers.
